**Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways**

**Scripture Title:** *Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways*
**Original Attribution:** Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting.
**Volume:** One.
**Source Text:** From the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongxuan Section*, *Records and Biographies*.

**Preface to the *Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways***

When Heaven and Earth first parted, the clear and turbid separated, melting into rivers and congealing into mountains. Some align with the celestial lodges above, while others conceal grotto-heavens below. All are governed by the Great Saints and Supreme Perfected Ones, where divine palaces and jade mansions stand, golden terraces and cloud-wrought halls arise—some formed by condensed *qi*, others by the coagulation of mist. There are jade pools and emerald ponds flowing to the four corners, pearl trees and coral groves flourishing upon the land. Here, the phoenixes of the gods take flight, and the dragons of heaven, the sacred fish, and the marsh steeds find their abode. Some lie beneath the sun’s chariot, others beneath the stars’ embrace, harboring wind and rain, storing clouds and thunder, serving as the pivots of Heaven and Earth, the axles of *yin* and *yang*. Now rising in splendor above the seas, now receding into the void of the heavens, some are entwined by the Weak Waters, others sundered by vast waves. Some dwell where sunlight never reaches, where human footsteps never tread—all recorded in the secret scrolls of the true scriptures.

The Grand Historian said: "Within the vast wilderness, there are five thousand renowned mountains, among which the Five Peaks stand as guardians, with ten mountains as their aides." The *Jade Scripture of Mount Gui* further states: "Within the great heavens, there are thirty-six grotto-heavens, each with its own sun, moon, stars, and palaces of the immortals, governing sin and fortune, recording life and death. There reside the Highest Perfected and the Kings of the Immortals." Beyond the seas lie the Five Peaks, the Three Isles, the Ten Continents, the thirty-six *jinglu* retreats, the seventy-two blessed lands, the twenty-four transformations, and the four guardian mountains. This volume compiles them all for the edification of those who seek such wonders.

As for the locations of immortal cities, the names of those who attained the Dao, the lords of grotto-palaces, and the ranks of the celestial bureaus—these matters are too vast and intricate to record in full. Thus, I have merely noted the prefectures and counties under their jurisdiction, along with the general count of immortal altars and Daoist temples.

On the *guiwei* day of the fourth day of the eighth month in the *xinyou* year of the Tianfu era, the Feathered Man of Huading Peak, Du Guangting, compiled this at the Jade Bureau in Chengdu.

**Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways**
Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting.

The Sacred Peaks and Myriad Mountains

The Mysterious Capital Jade Capital Mountain lies at the center of Great Luo, above Jade Purity. Yuanjing Mountain stands before Jade Capital, Mount Emei before it as well, Guangxia Mountain to its right, Hongying Mountain to its left, Zikong Mountain to its left, and Wuwen Mountain behind it. These mountains, situated above Jade Purity and below Great Luo, encircle the Mysterious Capital Jade Capital Mountain as its auxiliary wings.

Sanshou Mountain lies before Jade Capital, Jinhua Mountain to its right, Handong Ling Mountain to its right, Xiuhua Mountain to its right, Sanbao Mountain behind it, Feixia Mountain behind it, and Fujué Kong Mountain within Supreme Purity. These mountains of the Three Realms are all transformations of primordial *qi*, with palaces above where the Great Sages roam, corresponding below to the thirteen organs of the human body—details of which are recorded in the *Scripture of the Great Cavern*.

The Eastern Peak, Mount Guang Sang, lies in the Eastern Sea, where the Azure Emperor resides. The Southern Peak, Mount Chang Gao, lies in the Southern Sea, where the Vermilion Emperor resides. The Western Peak, Mount Li Nong, lies in the Western Sea, where the White Emperor resides. The Northern Peak, Mount Guang Ye, lies in the Northern Sea, where the Black Emperor resides. The Central Peak, Mount Kunlun, lies amid the Nine Seas, with the Thousand Dawn Star as the heart of Heaven and Earth.

Mount Fanghu lies in the Northern Sea, thirty thousand *li* from shore. Mount Fusang lies in the Eastern Sea, spanning ten thousand *li*, where the sun emerges. Mount Penglai lies in the Eastern Sea, rising a thousand *li* high. Mount Lianshi lies in the southeast, at the *chen-si* position. Mount Wo Jiao lies in the Eastern Sea, where a hundred rivers flow without filling it. Mount Fangzhang lies in the Great Sea, rising 497,000 *zhang*. Mount Zhong lies in the Northern Wilderness, north of the Weak Waters, 19,000 *li* away. Mount Yuanjiao lies in the Great Sea, its summit brushing the sun and moon. Mount Daiyu lies in the Vast Sea. Mount Dengdu lies beneath the Nine Ramparts, or in the *gui* region, governing ghosts and spirits.

The Dark Continent lies in the Northern Sea, spanning 7,000 *li*. Yingzhou, also called Green Mound, lies in the Eastern Sea. Muzhou lies in the Eastern Sea, spanning 500 *li*. Zuzhou lies in the Eastern Sea, spanning 10,000 *li*, where the herb of immortality grows. Yuanzhou lies in the Great Sea, spanning 3,000 *li*. Changzhou lies in the Vast Sea, spanning 5,000 *li*. Liuzhou lies in the Western Sea, spanning 3,000 *li*. Fenglinzhou lies in the Western Sea, yielding the glue of unbroken bowstrings. Juquzhou lies in the Western Sea, spanning 10,000 *li*, yielding the incense of returning souls. Yanzhou lies in the Southern Sea, spanning 2,000 *li*. Shengzhou lies in the Western Sea, spanning 2,500 *li*. Canghai Island lies in the Great Sea, rising 50,000 *li*.

These Ten Continents, Three Islands, and Five Peaks all lie around Kunlun in the four directions, amid the vast seas—abodes of immortals and domains governed by the Five Emperors, beyond the reach of mortal men.

The Five Peaks of the Middle Kingdom

The Eastern Peak, Mount Tai, whose peak spirit is the Heavenly Equal King, commands 90,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans 1,000 *li* in circumference, located in Fengfu County, Yanzhou. Mount Luofu and Mount Kuocang serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Meng and Mount Dong serve as its administrative aids.

The Southern Peak, Mount Heng, whose peak spirit is the Controller of Heaven King, commands 30,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans 2,000 *li* in circumference, with Mount Huo and Mount Song as its reserves, and Mount Tiantai and Mount Gouqu as its auxiliary luminaries.

The Central Peak, Mount Song Gao, whose peak spirit is the Central Heaven King, commands 120,000 immortal officials and jade maidens, serving as the lord of the five soils. The mountain spans 1,000 *li* in circumference, located in Gaocheng County, Luozhou. Mount Shaoshi and Mount Wudang in the Eastern Capital serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Taihe and Mount Luhun jointly assist in governance.

The Western Peak, Mount Hua, whose peak spirit is the Golden Heaven King, commands 70,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans over 2,000 *li* in circumference, located in Huayin County, Huazhou. Mount Difei and Mount Nüji serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Xicheng, Mount Qingcheng, Mount Emei, Mount Fan Zhong, Mount Rong, and Mount Xixuan Jushan jointly assist in governance.

The Northern Peak, Mount Heng, whose peak spirit is the Peaceful Heaven King, commands 50,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans 2,000 *li* in circumference, located in Zhenzhou. Mount Hefeng and Mount Baodu serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Xuanlong, Mount Kongtong, and Mount Yangluo assist in governance.

Second, the Grand Existence Grotto-Heaven of Weiyu, spanning 10,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Sima Jiyi, located in Wuzhou.

Third, the Supreme Mystery United-One Grotto-Heaven of Xicheng, spanning 3,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Wang Fangping, located in Shuzhou.

Fourth, the Three Mysteries Utmost Truth Grotto-Heaven of Xixuan, spanning 2,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Master Pei, located in Jinzhou.

Fifth, the Nine-Chambered Treasure Immortal Grotto-Heaven of Qingcheng, spanning 2,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Lord Xiao, located in Qingcheng County, Shuzhou.

Sixth, the Supreme Jade Purity Level Grotto-Heaven of Chicheng, spanning 800 *li* in circumference, governed by Lord Wang, located in Tangxing County, Taizhou.

Seventh, the Vermilion Brightness Radiant Truth Grotto-Heaven of Luofu, spanning 1,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Ge Hong, located in Boluo County, Xiuzhou.

Eighth, the Golden Altar Flourishing Yang Grotto-Heaven of Gouqu, spanning 150 *li* in circumference, governed by the Mao Lords, located in Jurong County, Runzhou.

Ninth, the Forest Chamber Grotto-Left Divine Dark Ruins Heaven, spanning 400 *li* in circumference, spiritually governed by Dragon Might Elder, located in Wuxian County, Suzhou.

Tenth, the Kuocang Grotto Accomplished Virtue Recollecting Truth Heaven, spanning 300 *li* in circumference, governed by Ping Zhongjie, located in Le’an County, Taizhou.

The above Ten Great Grotto-Heavens and the Five Marchmounts are all presided over by perfected transcendents and supreme immortals, to bless the world and command the host of spirits.

Sunlit Peace Transformation: Metal of the Five Phases, Cold Dew as its solar term, corresponding above to the Horn Mansion. Those born on *jiǎzǐ*, *jiǎyín*, or *jiǎxū* days belong here. Its upper transformation lies forty *li* within the borders of Jiulong County in Pengzhou, while its lower transformation lies four *li* within the borders of Xindu. Immortals Zhai Xianye and Zhang Heng ascended in white daylight here.

Deer Hall Transformation: Wood of the Five Phases, Frost Descent as its solar term, corresponding above to the Neck Mansion. Those born on *wùwǔ*, *yǐmǎo*, or *wùshēn* days belong here. Twenty *li* northwest of Mianzhu in Hanzhou, in the second year of the Yongshou era, the Heavenly Worthy and Celestial Master swore oaths to the myriad spirits at this site, where celestial sustenance was bestowed upon those who dwelled here.

Crane Cry Transformation: Metal of the Five Phases, Winter Commencement as its solar term, corresponding above to the Chamber, Heart, and Winnowing Basket Mansions. Those born on *gēngchén* or *rénchén* days belong here. Over thirty *li* west of Dayi County in Yizhou, north of Yonghu, more than three *li* from the county seat, this is where the Heavenly Worthy bestowed the *Register* upon the Celestial Master. Xu Xiaodao, He Danyang, and Ma Chengzi ascended here.

Twenty-five *li* northwest of Pengshan County in Meizhou; also named Wealth Mountain, frequented by the sagely immortals. The site of Wang Ziqiao’s ascent.

Root Bamboo Transformation: Wood of the Five Phases, Grain Rain as its solar term, corresponding above to the Stomach Mansion. Those born on *yǐsì*, *xīnsì*, or *xīnhài* days belong here. Twenty-five *li* northwest of Xinjin County in Shuzhou, where the Yellow Emperor sojourned. Guo Shengzi ascended here; named for the sweeping-altar bamboo.

Mengqin Transformation: Fire of the Five Phases, Summer Commencement as its solar term, corresponding above to the Pleiades Mansion. Those born on *jiǎxū* or *bǐngxū* days belong here. Fifteen *li* from Taideng County in Junzhou, where Yi Yin, Zhao Gui, Zhao Sheng, and Prince Zhao ascended.

Level Canopy Transformation: Earth of the Five Phases, Lesser Fullness as its solar term, corresponding above to the Net Mansion. Those born on *dīngsì*, *jǐsì*, or *guǐsì* days belong here. Thirty *li* north of Xinjin County in Shuzhou. The mountain is home to a royal person, thirteen feet in height, whose emergence heralds great peace under heaven. Immortal Cui Xiaotong ascended here.

Cloud Terrace Transformation: Fire of the Five Phases, Grain in Ear as its solar term, corresponding above to the Turtle Beak and Orion Mansions. Those born on *bǐngwǔ*, *gēngwǔ*, or *gēngxū* days belong here. Thirty-five *li* southeast of Cangxi County in Lizhou, where the Celestial Master ascended on the ninth day of the ninth month in the second year of the Yongshou era.

Exhausted Valley Transformation: Wood of the Five Phases, Summer Solstice as its solar term, corresponding above to the Well Mansion. Those born on *yǐyǒu* or *dīngyǒu* days belong here. Five *li* from Xixian in Xingyuan Prefecture, where Chen Anshi and the Lady of Bao ascended.

Rear Wall Transformation: Earth of the Five Phases, Lesser Heat as its solar term, corresponding above to the Ghost Mansion. Those born on *xīnyǒu* or *guǐyǒu* days belong here. Sixty-five *li* northwest of Shifang County in Hanzhou, where the Celestial Master bestowed upon Xia Ziran the Way of Guarding Unity before his ascent in broad daylight.

Duke’s Tomb Transformation: Metal of the Five Phases, Greater Heat as its solar term, corresponding above to the Willow Mansion. Those born on *jiǎshēn*, *rénshēn*, or *gēngshēn* days belong here. Fifty *li* northwest of Zhuyu County in Hanzhou, where the Celestial Master bestowed upon Su Ziyu the *Jade Writ in Purple Script* before his ascent in broad daylight.

Level Ridge Transformation: Water of the Five Phases, Autumn Commencement as its solar term, corresponding above to the Star Mansion. Those born on *wùxū* or *dīnghài* days belong here. Four *li* southwest of Xinjin County in Shuzhou; also named Numinous Spring Transformation. Li E and Di Jun ascended here.

Registrar Transformation: Metal of the Five Phases, End of Heat as its solar term, corresponding above to the Extended Net Mansion. Those born on *yǐwèi*, *jǐwèi*, or *guǐwèi* days belong here. Thirty *li* northeast of Pujiang County in Yizhou; also named Autumn Growth Transformation. The site of the ascent of Registrar Wang Xing and the female immortal Yang Zhengjian.

Jade Bureau Transformation: Water of the Five Phases, White Dew as its solar term, corresponding above to the Wings Mansion. Those born on *dīngwèi* or *xīnwèi* days belong here. One *li* south of Chengdu Prefecture; also named Jade Maiden Transformation. In the first year of *Yongshou* of Celestial Master Lord Lao, he descended here, where the earth welled forth a jade bureau, hence the name.

Northern Yue Transformation: Earth of the Five Phases, Autumn Equinox as its solar term, corresponding above to the Pine Mansion. Those born on *wùzǐ* or *jiǎwǔ* days belong here. Northeast of the capital city. Wu Chengzi, Bo He, Prince Jin of Wang, Lü Gong, and Lü Wenqi ascended here. In the second year of *Longshuo*, Lord Lao appeared.

*Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Famous Mountains* concludes.

**Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways**

**Scripture Title:** *Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways*
**Original Attribution:** Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting.
**Volume:** One.
**Source Text:** From the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongxuan Section*, *Records and Biographies*.

---

**Preface to the *Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways***

When Heaven and Earth first parted, the clear and turbid separated, melting into rivers and congealing into mountains. Some align with the celestial lodges above, while others conceal grotto-heavens below. All are governed by the Great Saints and Supreme Perfected Ones, where divine palaces and jade mansions stand, golden terraces and cloud-wrought halls arise—some formed by condensed *qi*, others by the coagulation of mist. There are jade pools and emerald ponds flowing to the four corners, pearl trees and coral groves flourishing upon the land. Here, the phoenixes of the gods take flight, and the dragons of heaven, the sacred fish, and the marsh steeds find their abode. Some lie beneath the sun’s chariot, others beneath the stars’ embrace, harboring wind and rain, storing clouds and thunder, serving as the pivots of Heaven and Earth, the axles of *yin* and *yang*. Now rising in splendor above the seas, now receding into the void of the heavens, some are entwined by the Weak Waters, others sundered by vast waves. Some dwell where sunlight never reaches, where human footsteps never tread—all recorded in the secret scrolls of the true scriptures.

The Grand Historian said: "Within the vast wilderness, there are five thousand renowned mountains, among which the Five Peaks stand as guardians, with ten mountains as their aides." The *Jade Scripture of Mount Gui* further states: "Within the great heavens, there are thirty-six grotto-heavens, each with its own sun, moon, stars, and palaces of the immortals, governing sin and fortune, recording life and death. There reside the Highest Perfected and the Kings of the Immortals." Beyond the seas lie the Five Peaks, the Three Isles, the Ten Continents, the thirty-six *jinglu* retreats, the seventy-two blessed lands, the twenty-four transformations, and the four guardian mountains. This volume compiles them all for the edification of those who seek such wonders.

As for the locations of immortal cities, the names of those who attained the Dao, the lords of grotto-palaces, and the ranks of the celestial bureaus—these matters are too vast and intricate to record in full. Thus, I have merely noted the prefectures and counties under their jurisdiction, along with the general count of immortal altars and Daoist temples.

On the *guiwei* day of the fourth day of the eighth month in the *xinyou* year of the Tianfu era, the Feathered Man of Huading Peak, Du Guangting, compiled this at the Jade Bureau in Chengdu.

**Record of Grotto-Heavens, Blessed Lands, Sacred Peaks, and Divine Waterways**
Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting.

The Sacred Peaks and Myriad Mountains

The Mysterious Capital Jade Capital Mountain lies at the center of Great Luo, above Jade Purity. Yuanjing Mountain stands before Jade Capital, Mount Emei before it as well, Guangxia Mountain to its right, Hongying Mountain to its left, Zikong Mountain to its left, and Wuwen Mountain behind it. These mountains, situated above Jade Purity and below Great Luo, encircle the Mysterious Capital Jade Capital Mountain as its auxiliary wings.

Sanshou Mountain lies before Jade Capital, Jinhua Mountain to its right, Handong Ling Mountain to its right, Xiuhua Mountain to its right, Sanbao Mountain behind it, Feixia Mountain behind it, and Fujué Kong Mountain within Supreme Purity. These mountains of the Three Realms are all transformations of primordial *qi*, with palaces above where the Great Sages roam, corresponding below to the thirteen organs of the human body—details of which are recorded in the *Scripture of the Great Cavern*.

The Eastern Peak, Mount Guang Sang, lies in the Eastern Sea, where the Azure Emperor resides. The Southern Peak, Mount Chang Gao, lies in the Southern Sea, where the Vermilion Emperor resides. The Western Peak, Mount Li Nong, lies in the Western Sea, where the White Emperor resides. The Northern Peak, Mount Guang Ye, lies in the Northern Sea, where the Black Emperor resides. The Central Peak, Mount Kunlun, lies amid the Nine Seas, with the Thousand Dawn Star as the heart of Heaven and Earth.

Mount Fanghu lies in the Northern Sea, thirty thousand *li* from shore. Mount Fusang lies in the Eastern Sea, spanning ten thousand *li*, where the sun emerges. Mount Penglai lies in the Eastern Sea, rising a thousand *li* high. Mount Lianshi lies in the southeast, at the *chen-si* position. Mount Wo Jiao lies in the Eastern Sea, where a hundred rivers flow without filling it. Mount Fangzhang lies in the Great Sea, rising 497,000 *zhang*. Mount Zhong lies in the Northern Wilderness, north of the Weak Waters, 19,000 *li* away. Mount Yuanjiao lies in the Great Sea, its summit brushing the sun and moon. Mount Daiyu lies in the Vast Sea. Mount Dengdu lies beneath the Nine Ramparts, or in the *gui* region, governing ghosts and spirits.

The Dark Continent lies in the Northern Sea, spanning 7,000 *li*. Yingzhou, also called Green Mound, lies in the Eastern Sea. Muzhou lies in the Eastern Sea, spanning 500 *li*. Zuzhou lies in the Eastern Sea, spanning 10,000 *li*, where the herb of immortality grows. Yuanzhou lies in the Great Sea, spanning 3,000 *li*. Changzhou lies in the Vast Sea, spanning 5,000 *li*. Liuzhou lies in the Western Sea, spanning 3,000 *li*. Fenglinzhou lies in the Western Sea, yielding the glue of unbroken bowstrings. Juquzhou lies in the Western Sea, spanning 10,000 *li*, yielding the incense of returning souls. Yanzhou lies in the Southern Sea, spanning 2,000 *li*. Shengzhou lies in the Western Sea, spanning 2,500 *li*. Canghai Island lies in the Great Sea, rising 50,000 *li*.

These Ten Continents, Three Islands, and Five Peaks all lie around Kunlun in the four directions, amid the vast seas—abodes of immortals and domains governed by the Five Emperors, beyond the reach of mortal men.

The Five Peaks of the Middle Kingdom

The Eastern Peak, Mount Tai, whose peak spirit is the Heavenly Equal King, commands 90,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans 1,000 *li* in circumference, located in Fengfu County, Yanzhou. Mount Luofu and Mount Kuocang serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Meng and Mount Dong serve as its administrative aids.

The Southern Peak, Mount Heng, whose peak spirit is the Controller of Heaven King, commands 30,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans 2,000 *li* in circumference, with Mount Huo and Mount Song as its reserves, and Mount Tiantai and Mount Gouqu as its auxiliary luminaries.

The Central Peak, Mount Song Gao, whose peak spirit is the Central Heaven King, commands 120,000 immortal officials and jade maidens, serving as the lord of the five soils. The mountain spans 1,000 *li* in circumference, located in Gaocheng County, Luozhou. Mount Shaoshi and Mount Wudang in the Eastern Capital serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Taihe and Mount Luhun jointly assist in governance.

The Western Peak, Mount Hua, whose peak spirit is the Golden Heaven King, commands 70,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans over 2,000 *li* in circumference, located in Huayin County, Huazhou. Mount Difei and Mount Nüji serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Xicheng, Mount Qingcheng, Mount Emei, Mount Fan Zhong, Mount Rong, and Mount Xixuan Jushan jointly assist in governance.

The Northern Peak, Mount Heng, whose peak spirit is the Peaceful Heaven King, commands 50,000 immortal officials and jade maidens. The mountain spans 2,000 *li* in circumference, located in Zhenzhou. Mount Hefeng and Mount Baodu serve as its auxiliary commands, while Mount Xuanlong, Mount Kongtong, and Mount Yangluo assist in governance.

The Ten Great Grotto-Heavens

First, the Minor Existence Grotto-Heaven of Wangwu, spanning 10,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Wang Bao, located in Wangwu County, Luozhou.

Second, the Grand Existence Grotto-Heaven of Weiyu, spanning 10,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Sima Jiyi, located in Wuzhou.

Third, the Supreme Mystery United-One Grotto-Heaven of Xicheng, spanning 3,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Wang Fangping, located in Shuzhou.

Fourth, the Three Mysteries Utmost Truth Grotto-Heaven of Xixuan, spanning 2,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Master Pei, located in Jinzhou.

Fifth, the Nine-Chambered Treasure Immortal Grotto-Heaven of Qingcheng, spanning 2,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Lord Xiao, located in Qingcheng County, Shuzhou.

Sixth, the Supreme Jade Purity Level Grotto-Heaven of Chicheng, spanning 800 *li* in circumference, governed by Lord Wang, located in Tangxing County, Taizhou.

Seventh, the Vermilion Brightness Radiant Truth Grotto-Heaven of Luofu, spanning 1,000 *li* in circumference, governed by Ge Hong, located in Boluo County, Xiuzhou.

Eighth, the Golden Altar Flourishing Yang Grotto-Heaven of Gouqu, spanning 150 *li* in circumference, governed by the Mao Lords, located in Jurong County, Runzhou.

Immortals Zhai Xianye and Zhang Heng ascended in white daylight here.

Twenty *li* northwest of Mianzhu in Hanzhou, in the second year of the Yongshou era, the Heavenly Worthy and Celestial Master swore oaths to the myriad spirits at this site, where celestial sustenance was bestowed upon those who dwelled here.

Crane Cry Transformation: Metal of the Five Phases, Winter Commencement as its solar term, corresponding above to the Chamber, Heart, and Winnowing Basket Mansions. Those born on *gēngchén* or *rénchén* days belong here. Over thirty *li* west of Dayi County in Yizhou, north of Yonghu, more than three *li* from the county seat, this is where the Heavenly Worthy bestowed the *Register* upon the Celestial Master. Xu Xiaodao, He Danyang, and Ma Chengzi ascended here.

Misty Vastness Transformation: Earth of the Five Phases, Lesser Snow as its solar term, corresponding above to the Tail Mansion. Those born on *bǐngchén* or *wùchén* days belong here. Seventy *li* northwest of Jiulong County in Pengzhou, where the Heavenly Worthy bestowed upon Fan Li the Perfected the ascent in broad daylight.

Kudzu Continuation Transformation: Fire of the Five Phases, Greater Snow as its solar term, corresponding above to the Winnowing Basket Mansion. Those born on *jǐmǎo*, *dīngmǎo*, *xīnmǎo*, or *guǐmǎo* days belong here. Sixty *li* northwest of Jiulong County in Pengzhou, the abode of the Perfected of Supreme Clarity. Yang Xianxian, Pu Gaoyuan, and Ge Yongfen ascended here; originally named Supreme Clarity Transformation.

Metal Elimination Transformation: Water of the Five Phases, Winter Solstice as its solar term, corresponding above to the Dipper Mansion. Those born on *bǐngyín*, *gēngzǐ*, or *rénxū* days belong here. Thirty *li* east of Mianzhu County in Hanzhou, corresponding to the Heavenly Metal Elimination Palace. Zhang Lizi ascended in broad daylight here.

Qinzhong Transformation: Water of the Five Phases, Lesser Cold as its solar term, corresponding above to the Ox Mansion. Those born on *wùyín*, *gēngyín*, or *rényín* days belong here. Twenty *li* north of Deyang County in Hanzhou, where the August Person bestowed upon Han Zhong the *Golden Writ of Astral Scripts* before ascending.

True Multitude Transformation: Metal of the Five Phases, Greater Cold as its solar term, corresponding above to the Woman Mansion. Those born on *yǐchǒu* or *dīngchǒu* days belong here. Twenty-five *li* northwest of Jintang County in Hanzhou, the site of the assembly of the Heavenly Worthy and Celestial Master. Wang Fangping and Li Zhenduo ascended here; also named Supreme Perfection Transformation.

Prosperous Benefit Transformation: Earth of the Five Phases, Spring Commencement as its solar term, corresponding above to the Void Mansion. Those born on *jǐyǒu* or *jǐchǒu* days belong here. Twenty *li* east of Jintang County in Hanzhou, where Li Baba refined the elixir twice and ascended.

Hidden Above Transformation: Water of the Five Phases, Rain Water as its solar term, corresponding above to the Rooftop Mansion. Those born on *xīnchǒu* or *guǐchǒu* days belong here. Fifty *li* north of Deyang County in Hanzhou, where Li Ziyuan and Wei Shuqing ascended.

Dense Thorn Transformation: Water of the Five Phases, Vernal Equinox as its solar term, corresponding above to the Straddler Mansion. Those born on *rénzǐ* or *rénwǔ* days belong here. Ten *li* south of Xinjin County in Shuzhou, where the Yellow Emperor refined the elixir. The mountain bears a celestial pond, stone stele, and cinnabar turtle.

Twenty-five *li* northwest of Pengshan County in Meizhou; also named Wealth Mountain, frequented by the sagely immortals. The site of Wang Ziqiao’s ascent.

Rear Wall Transformation: Earth of the Five Phases, Lesser Heat as its solar term, corresponding above to the Ghost Mansion. Those born on *xīnyǒu* or *guǐyǒu* days belong here.
